content.rendered:
Hong Kong gov’t investigating scaffolding collapse injuring 11 workers

Seven male and four female construction workers were taken to hospital following an incident at the New Acute Hospital’s construction site in Kai Tak.
by Hillary Leung 3 hours ago18:29, 14 January 2025

Hong Kong’s first-ever giant panda twins to make public debut in February

Speaking at a press conference on Tuesday, Chief Executive John Lee said the two pandas – who live at Ocean Park – were nearly six months old. The public will be able to visit them next month.
by Hillary Leung 6 hours ago16:18, 14 January 2025

Sign up to the HKFP newsletters. We will not pass on your data to third parties.

Wife and son of wanted ex-pollster questioned by Hong Kong national security police – reports

Chung Kim-wah, who is wanted by police under the national security law, was formerly the deputy CEO of the Hong Kong Public Opinion Research Institute (HKPORI). He left Hong Kong in April 2022 to the UK, citing censorship fears.
by Hans Tse 9 hours ago15:41, 14 January 2025

Philippines alarmed by Chinese coast guard ships moving closer to shore

The Philippines said China’s deployment this month of a “monster” coast guard vessel demonstrated Beijing’s “increasing aggression” in the disputed South China Sea.
by AFP 3 hours ago18:12, 14 January 2025

70% of people in committed same-sex relationships want to marry, Hong Kong survey finds

Younger people in same-sex relationships were more likely to want to get married than older couples, but there was no statistical difference in the marital intentions between men and women, a survey by Chinese University of Hong Kong researchers found.
by Hillary Leung 12 hours ago12:31, 14 January 2025

Hong Kong police officer jailed for 3 years over forging statements to wrap investigations prematurely

Deputy District Court Judge Ivy Chui on Monday put Woo Siu-chun behind bars after the ex-police officer pleaded guilty to seven counts of misconduct in public office, according to local media reports.
by Hans Tse 12 hours ago09:04, 14 January 2025

Ex-Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam ‘welcomes’ office move from premium commercial unit to Immigration Tower

Opinion

A constitutional innovation: Never mind Hong Kong’s Basic Law, consider the context

Changing Hong Kong’s mini-constitution is “a matter for parliament, not something to be done in court in the name of ‘context’,” writes Tim Hamlett.
by Tim Hamlett

Have Hong Kong’s political appointments become a failed effort to meet discarded objectives?

“Since we no longer aspire to political pluralism, the idea of a politically neutral civil service has become meaningless,” writes Tim Hamlett.
by Tim Hamlett

Something went wrong. Please refresh the page and/or try again.

HKFP FEATURES, EXPLAINERS, LONG READS

Explainer: Hong Kong’s national security crackdown – month 54

December 2024 saw more overseas activists hit with arrest warrants and HK$1 million bounties, while authorities for the second time invoked powers under Hong Kong security legislation to cancel the passports of others already in their crosshairs.
by Hong Kong Free Press 10:00, 5 January 202512:35, 6 January 2025

Year in Review: 15 times Hong Kong made int’l headlines in 2024

Some stories that became international news in 2024 included the jailing of 45 prominent pro-democracy figures, media mogul Jimmy Lai testifying for the first time at his national security trial, and Lionel Messi’s no-show during a much-vaunted match.

2024 In Pictures: Pandas, landmark court cases, and a new security law for Hong Kong

From Taiwan’s presidential election to the fast-tracked passage of Hong Kong’s new security law, HKFP has captured some of the most influential moments of the past 12 months.
